wordpressPost.title: How to keep the weight off for good
wordpressPost.content:
How to keep the weight off for good


 


I am just going to get right to the point here!


If you’re a middle-aged woman and you’ve tried hard to lose weight with no luck, here is how I finally did it and how you can too.


 Eat low carbs every day!  


I know you’ve probably already tried this a time or two.  But, hear me out for a minute.


You will get used to it.  You will be a bit tired about the third day but you will overcome this, and your body will adjust.  


The key is to keep hydrated and have some snacks at hand when you feel tired.


I love carbs too believe me.  But I don’t miss them like before when I tried this.


 Move.  No matter what, do something for at least twenty minutes or more per day.


 Walk, do jumping jacks, do your steps, use the stairs, something. Download an app.


 Break it up if you have to but, move your body. 


 I do 15 minutes in the morning and 15 minutes in the afternoon.  That’s it.  


The best part about working out is when its over, oh yeah, and how you will look and feel too!


 It will take at least ten days to lose at least 3 to 5 pounds.  


Sorry, my friends, it’s not like when you were 20!  


You know, when you skipped a meal, and you dropped a pant size.😩  But, the weight you will lose is real weight and not just water. 


Once the first five pounds are gone, the rest will go even faster.


I promise that your clothes will begin to loosen after only a few days.


Last bit of news here,  you will have to do the 90/10 rule.


Meaning, this will be your new lifestyle 90 percent of the time you will eat lean protein and veggies and 10 percent of the time you can eat any carbs that you want.


That’s it!  Pretty simple right?


The problem is, with all health concerns aside, we can’t lose weight so easy as we age.  


The truth is, many of us gain ten pounds per decade as we age.  Ouch!


We try and control our eating, we get emotional, we get bored, we get around our partners, our friends and we revert to eating whatever we want.


 Remember, one night of chips, guacamole and, an entree leads to  waking up and starting all over again 😩  


We’ve all been on this train ride.


Today is the day.


And one more thing, you know how they say “eat good carbs” not bad carbs?  Well, carbs are carbs and they convert to insulin and if we don’t burn it off, we gain weight.  Simple as that.


Stick to lean protein and, (I know drill sergeant here…)  veggies 90% of the time.


 


How to keep the weight off for good


 


I think it was Tony Robbins or someone else that said “We do more to avoid pain then we do pleasure.”  


So you have to ask yourself what’s more painful, not eating the chips or gaining ten pounds per decade?


I say give it a try.  It takes a few days to get used to it.  But your cravings will pass and your pleasure will increase by the way you look and feel.


 ❤️
